title: There's a Hippo in My Tub
text:
There's a Hippo in My Tub is a 1977 children's album by <a href="Anne%20Murray">Anne Murray</a>. Though the album did not make any of the major charts in the U.S. or Canada, it was certified Platinum in Canada. The album was initially reissued in 1979 by Sesame Street Records entitled ""Anne Murray Sings for the "<a href="Sesame%20Street">Sesame Street</a>" Generation"". It was again reissued in 2001 in CD format by EMI Music Canada, including three extra songs not on the original album. It was produced by Pat Riccio, Jr.
As "Anne Murray Sings for the Sesame Street Generation", the album was nominated for the <a href="22nd%20Annual%20Grammy%20Awards">1980 Grammy Awards</a> in the <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Best%20Children%27s%20Album">Best Children's Album</a> category, where it was up against two other "Sesame Street"-branded albums and the soundtrack to "<a href="The%20Muppet%20Movie">The Muppet Movie</a>", which won.
